thread.title: Jason Pierre-Paul reportedly in town, but many hurdles to Giants return remain
thread.title_full: Jason Pierre-Paul reportedly in town, but many hurdles to Giants return remain

author: James Kratch | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Jason Pierre-Paul reportedly in town, but many hurdles to Giants return remain
text:
WATCH : Exclusive video from Victor Cruz's new documentary 
Pierre-Paul did not sign his $14.8 million franchise tender before the accident, and the Giants have not rescinded the tender, so the contract is still on the table. However, the Giants, unsure of how effective Pierre-Paul will be on the field once he returns, are unlikely to pay Pierre-Paul a prorated amount of that tender. 
Instead, they should seek to give Pierre-Paul a much smaller, likely incentive-laden deal. Pierre-Paul's full tender pays him roughly $871,000 for each week of the season; if he were to sign this week, he would be due about $8.71 million. That is a large price for a player coming off a traumatic injury that could have a significant impact on how he plays the game. 
Since Pierre-Paul is technically a free agent, the Giants and his camp would have to negotiate any change in compensation, which could drag out the process further. This is Pierre-Paul's second visit as a free agent, the last allowed by NFL bylaws. He has until Nov. 17 to sign with the Giants, otherwise he will be ineligible to play during the 2015 season per conditions of the franchise tender system. 
And even if Pierre-Paul's hand checks out and he reaches an agreement with the team, then comes the real questions: Can he still play? Will he be anywhere near as productive after such severe injuries? How quickly can he get in game shape and on the field? 
Giants coach Tom Coughlin told reporters earlier Monday that, "to my knowledge, he's not here at this point in time. When he does, we'll let you know. And it's all going to start with the medical (process)." 
Those comments came a few days after Coughlin said " I wish I knew " when asked where Pierre-Paul stood. But, it now appears an answer is coming in the immediate future. What the answer is, though, remains unknown.
